section.title: Loan Repayment with Level Payments
section.p: By far, the most common way to pay off a loan is through constant payments, with K_t = K for all t. More formally, we say that we are paying the loan with level payments.

introduction.p: When a loan is repaid with level payments, the payments are a level-payment annuity and the loan amount is the present value.

task.p: Write a simple formula for L, assuming you know K, n, and \iota.
Write a simple formula for K, assuming you know L, n, and \iota.

introduction.p: The following loans are all paid back using level payments. Find the indicated value.

task.p: A loan for 120,000 carries a term of 30 years with monthly payments. The interest rate is 9%, convertible monthly. Find the monthly payment.
A loan has a term of 12 years with quarterly payments of 584.64. The interest rate is 3.5%. Find the loan amount.
A loan for 25,000 carries a term of 12 years with annual payments of 2981.93. Find the effective annual interest rate.
A loan for 50,000 carries an effective quarterly interest rate of 5%. The loan is paid off with quarterly payments of 2,641.41. Find the term (round to the nearest whole number).

A common problem feature involves having a loan refinanced at a new interest rate. Consider the following problem:

Wanda and Vision purchase a home in Westview for 300,000 with a 30-year mortgage at an effective annual interest rate of 4%. Payments are to be made at the end of each month. Suppose after 10 years, a new bank offers to refinance the loan at a lower interest rate of 3%. Find the difference between the original monthly payment and the new monthly payment if they accept the refinance offer.
